author: d00dz
title: 3181 Review
review:
Information:
48cm (l) x 28cm (h) x 7.5cm (w)
720 grams - Total
216 grams - Box Only

Images of what's inside: http://members.iinet.net.au/~doodz/lego/City2010/3181/P1020579%20(Small).JPG

Building this was really easy. Instructions were simple and clear. Took about an hour with breaks taking photos.
The set is pretty funky to build, it kind of reminded me of the Titanic as I was building it from the base up.

The plane, once built, measures approx 37cms long and 38 cm wide (depending on the end wings), and 14cm high.

I really liked the interior of the plane as the windows used 20 clear pieces for ten windows.
The two engines were interesting too as it uses some Technic bits. Wheels all move as does the towing car.

3 minifigs are present. One of them had a suitcase which was able to be opened.

The towing car reminded me of some of the older mini car sets I used to play with.

Pros: Easy to build, moveable. Towing car is cool. Price is CHEAP for the size!

Cons: Wish it made noises and had more moving parts, but I guess that's more to do with Technics.

A great set for any plane airport collection.

For a full review with many pictures visit:
http://www.eurobricks.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=38058

author: campfire01
title: Better than 7893 and 7894
review:
Lego has finally released a 2x4 flat tile that goes on the roof of this plane.
Inside it is single file, with no "doorway" to the cockpit. That said, it is better than the planes in 7893 and 7894, because there are more bricks. 

The fact that it comes with a radar is helpful to anyone who has an Airport. It's not much really but it looks cool on a runway and adds to the authenticity. The minifigs are good but nothing new: an airport worker of sorts, a passenger and a pilot. It is more like a Lear or private jet than a passenger plane, but you could modify it. 

The truck is good, it comes with two seats, but is once again nothing special. The size scale is good and the wings are great because they aren't pre-made.

I got this for NZD 70, which is a bit steep considering that the last one was $80 and bigger. If you can get this on special, great.

author: jake9
title: VERY cool jet
review:
If you like LEGO planes then you've got to get this set. The jet is very cool! It carries six passengers with room in the back for some luggage. It is more of a business/private jet then an airliner. The colors are subtle and realistic. The cockpit is nice since it has painted tiles and a slope surrounding three sides of the pilot. The nose piece and tail piece are large molded parts that are pretty normal for today's sets. They give the aircraft a real aerodynamic look.

The car and the tower are mediocre and don't add much to the set. I suppose they add some playability, however.

Overall, this is a very cool jet to add to your airport or whatever other aircraft you have. Highly recommended.

author: youngtom
title: minifigs car traffic radar and plane
review:
This was made by my brother who has the account youngdave
OK, First, the mini figs!

1. Passenger. Item: brown suitcase that opens
2. Service Man. Items: light on stick and knit cap
3. Pilot. Items: walkie talkie and pilots cap

Second, the tow truck! The tow truck is small. It fits two mini figs and has a place to put the light on the stick and the walkie talkie. The tow truck is yellow and white and has two blue seats.

Third, the traffic radar!  The traffic radar has one sticker on it and spins.

Fourth, the plane! The plane has seven seats and some cargo space. The cockpit has one seat.  There is no co pilot. The entire plane has eight stickers.

All together the set has nine stickers. I paid $46 dollars at Amazon. It's worth the money. It has great playability. All it needs is the airport to go with. This set comes with great parts. Some parts are new.
This has great building experience. If you are buying it for a smaller child, help them build it.
Overall, I give this set five stars. This set is a must have. Hope my review was helpful.

author: Firox_5000
title: Good but not quite as good the 2006 version
review:
I bought this at the Lego shop a little while back for only £30 .

 

The set itself includes three figures . A pilot , passenger and cargo mover . It also includes the plane itself , a traffic radar and a vehicle which moves the plane .

 

NOw comparing this to the 2006 the set is smaller and sleekier and probably more sturdy as well as having more play features which include the traffic control radar and ground vehicle . The inside is also more sleekier with the only down point being that the front has only 1 seat for 1 pilot .  Another major con being that the set costs exacly the same is the 2006 version but yet is only 2/3 of the size and shows how much the price has gone up since . The price count is also -41 which I reefer a decent count is 10p a piece .

 

If you want a sleeky and small plane buy this one .

 

But if you want a better sized and value one try and get the 2006 one which has a better price .

 

Make your choice

review:
this lego set is worth the money when i got it i had to buy a mini fig set so the wold be filled. so unless if you have a bunch of extras mini figs your going to have 5 empty seats.

                    pros:rare i think mini fig torso.

author: The_Beast
title: Lets pu it this way, I built it in my car in 30 minutes.
review: This was a really easy set to build because there were so few pieces. I think that this Passenger Plane is better looking than the old one but it is still not that good. The price to piece ratio was poor and there were not enough Minifigures, I would've prefered 3 more and pay $10 more. The set fits in nicely with Airport but unless you really want this set I wouldn't reccomend it. I do enjoy this set, the only major design problem was that the wheels underneath always fall off.

author: Agent_Fuse
title: Not good, not bad. The average set.
review:
Okay, for my first review!

To start off, I wouldn't really call this a good set. The inside has very bad detail, unlike the last passenger plane, and it's missing a door, has no mobile staircase and lacks passengers.
 It's a great build but gets repetitive, making the roof slices, more roof slices, more... The little car that comes with it is okay but not up to standards and very feeble. The antenna is nice, and is the reason I gave the 'Parts' an extra brick. The minifigures are alright too but they need more accessories. This set is overpriced by $15.00, and doesn't deserve its cost.

Pros:
  • Antenna
  • Vehicle
  • Many seats
  • Plane Doesn't break easily
Cons:

  • Bad play quality
  • vehicle breaks easily
  • Not enough accesories
  • OVERPRICED!

I'm kinda disappointed with this set but it's alright for now. It needs more detail and a less annoying build!

title: minifigs, car, traffic radar and plane
review:
OK, First, the mini figs!


1. Passenger. Item: brown suitcase that opens

author: coldcomfort
title: 3181 Passenger Plane - Worth owning, but it won't be your favorite.
review:
This is the first set that I bought when I decided to get back into Lego building. I likely would have bought one of several other sets (such as the 7641 City Corner), but the selection at my local retailers was poor. This appeared to be a promising set and the only one in the price range I wanted to start with, so I pulled the trigger.

Pros

  • At just under 13 cents American per piece, I feel that this set was priced reasonably.
  • There are several interesting elements included in this set that lend themselves well to other imaginative building projects.
  • The build turned out to be quite substantial. The plane is very solid and while my models don't see any "play" in the traditional sense, I see no reason that it wouldn't wear well in the hands of reasonably reserved children. The tow vehicle, in the tradition of small Lego cars, is an absolute brick.

Cons

  • So many seats in the plane, but just one passenger.
  • While the outward appearance of the plane is quite detailed and realistic, the interior represents an unfortunate missed opportunity. A single row of seats without even room to pass them isn't even close to what I would have liked to see.
  • In order for this set to be truly superlative, it would need to be two seats wide throughout and include at least three more minifigures (specifically I would like to see a co-pilot, a flight attendant and either one more passenger or another member of the support crew).

  I'm glad I own this set and I had a good time building it. Unlike some others I did not find the build to be too repetitive and I didn't get bored or lose interest at any time during the hour and a half I spent building it (I like to be meticulous with the decals). If you enjoy the airport/aeronautics aspect of the City theme, you will certainly like this set. It will look great sitting on the tarmac when I get the airport.

author: av8r1973
title: Nice second plane for the airport
review:
As the review title suggests, this jet isn't much good unless you actually have an airport (I am waiting for the airport to go on sale in Taiwan before I can buy it). As other reviews mention, there aren't any stairs, no evident way for people to get in and out of the plane and really nowhere for them to go.

With that said, the set is still very nice.  It's not as big as the jet that comes with the airport set, but is more like one of the regional airliners (I think the interior is actually bigger than some I have flown on).  Pretty standard build, but I wish the wheels retracted.  Even my little Creator set has retractable gear.  It would have added some realism and there is definitely room for them in the center of the plane.  At least they are tandem tires like the real ones.

Perhaps the best part of the kit is the realistic tow bar and approach control radar.  The radar set is a great addition to the airport set (or it will be, in my case).  It's sturdy and has a great way to secure the base.  I will be implementing that on my City Garage communications antenna soon.  The tow bar for the tug is almost a perfect model of the real thing.  Well done!  The tug is more like one of those electric airport passenger shuttle than a real tug.  I think I will need to construct my own heavy-duty tug like the real airports have.

One minor gripe is the roof section.  It's rather clumsy to get the top of the plane off to cram passengers inside.  I need to put my fingernail under the roofline to pry it up.  Perhaps two less lugs per section would make it easier to lift off - like the City Train.

My 3 and 5yo daughters put it together with help on the instructions and they both love playing with it.  I recommend this kit if you have, or are planning to get, the airport.

author: cityboy518ipswich
title: A Nice Set, But More Minifigs Would Of Been Better
review:
Ok, so I picked this set up from Toys R Us for £34.99. I was a little hesitant at first, but decided to buy it.

 

The Box:

A Big box for what you get, it should of been at least half the size.

 

The Minifigs:

You Get 3. 3 IN A £34.99 SET! It should of had at least 3 more for an extra £4.00.

But anyway, you get a pilot, a service man and a passenger. c'mon only one passenger, you can do better than that lego!

 

The Control Tower and Service Vehicle:

I like the control tower and the service vehicle alot. They are simple, yet fun and I had more fun building these than the actual plane! You get a radio and a light on the service vehicle.

 

The Plane:

The plane is pretty big, bigger than it should be. Planes should be like they were in the classic town period. Small, yet fit in with a town. But it's still alright. I don't like the big cockpit and rear sections, they are juniorised, and it makes me think of the Over-Juniorised period of lego town in 1998-2000. But other than that, it's a nice plane. I use the rear as a cargo hold.

 

Overall rating:

It's Quite a nice set but could use some improvements. Still, that's whats MOCing is for!

But overall I give it a 4/5

author: Legomdrf
title: Not so good
review:
When I bought it I was excited but with time I have come to see that it isn't as good as I thought.

 

Pros:

*Cool design

*Engines are on the back of the plane which is unusual

*Airplane towing vehicle

*Radar

 

Cons:

*The airplane looks so small

*The interior is so small

*The cockpit has space for only one pilot

*There is only one row of seats for passengers

*No door

 

I would give this set a 3 out of 5.

author: beegeedee
title: A solid airplane but could be better
review:
Besides the airplanes occasionally available from airlines, there are only 3 relatively current airplanes I can think of, the seaplane, the one in the airport and this one. I know a lot of folks think the airport one is a let-down with its pre-molded wing.

At 309 parts (+ the 4 spares) it's a fairly small set. The 3 minifigures are nothing out of the ordinary - a passenger, a pilot and a worker who, for me anyway stands out since he has a 'wooly' hat instead of the normal hard helmet or cap type hats that usually come with these types of figures.

The box comes with 4 bags, 2 books and a sheet of stickers - thankfully not too many. 3 bags are for the plane itself along with the larger book, about 60 pages including all the filler pages and the other bag and book is for the tow vehicle and radar tower.

The vehicle is quite nice and I particularly like the design of the towing bar, my only grumble is you have to lift the airplane to hook it up. The car can seat 2 people and if you put the passenger on it, there's nowhere to put the suitcase that comes with him but it's a minor point.

The radar tower is simpe taking just 6 pages of instructions to cover its assembly. In spite of its simplicity it is quite effective and stands about 15cm tall (6"). The main part of the tower is a pre-molded part taking up about 11cm of the height but I think this is more effective than what could have been done with blocks.

The aircraft itself is quite nice. It's roughy 35cm (14") long and has a wingspan of about 33cm (13") and stands about 14cm high (5.5") There are a few flaws such a lack of a door, minifig accessories and the wing tips are easy to knock off. the front and back are largely pre-molded pieces and the cockpit is removed to put the pilot in and out. The roof along the length of the aircraft can also be removed to put passengers in the plane which seats 6 + the pilot. The wings are made up from various plates which means storing the model disassembled is easier than the airplane in 3182 Airport.

Overall build time is probably about 30 minutes for an adult, probably a lot longer for a kid with the windows being fiddly and the engines as well.

Playability on its own is probably quite limited but combined with the airport and additional minifigures it would be quite fun.

Pros

  • Airplane is a mostly good design
  • Worker minifigure
  • Towbar on vehicle is a nice design
  • Minimal sticker use

Cons

  • The wing tips are flimsy
  • More minifigures please
  • The radar tower while quite good is pointless if you have the airport
  • Airplane is a little narrow - no aisle space
  • Only a briefcase for passenger. Some mugs or goblets for passengers would be good.

Don't let the negatives deter you. It's a mostly good model, if overpriced, and is a nice addition to the airport. The radar could be left out and more minifigures in its place would make for a better set. The vehicle while functional is fairly basic and could be improved upon although its towbar is very nice.


Final advice: wait for a sale and get it then but do get it if you wish to add to the airport.

author: phipfwe76
title: Nice addition to any airport
review:
Picked up this set a while ago and I think it's a great add to any lego airport. The build is a lot like all the others, however it has the engines at the back of the plane like a 727. It's got a nice color, but there isn't much going on inside the plane. Only room for one pilot. I do really like the tow truck. It's a very nice feature that can be used on some other planes as well.

 

Overall, it's not the newest idea, but it's a very solid set that's worth the buy.

author: deelio777
title: Realistic jet perfect for any lego airport!
review: I for one actually really, really liked this set, particularly because of the realistic details of the plane and its overall look and design. Like any other Lego City set (specifically "airport" or "transportation"), this set's build is very straight forward and it comes with three minifigs (pilot, passenger, and maintenance worker), an airplane "tow" vehicle, a small radar tower, and, of course, THE AIRPLANE! I like the plane's blue/white color scheme and how realistic the wings and jet engines look. The landing gear is very nice and I like how Lego inserted the hinged wing tips for a more realistic look. The exterior is great, but the interior lacks a lot of important components that takes away from the realism of the jet. Even though it's a smaller plane, there are no aisles (i.e. only one row of seats and most planes have at least two rows and one aisle). There's room for only one pilot in the cockpit which, even though it's not very realistic, it isn't much of a problem for me because Lego planes I've gotten and built myself in the past have usually had room for only one pilot. The back of the plane features a nice hollow area to store luggage and the tail is amazing on this airplane because of its sturdiness and beauty. The fuselage is well-designed, though there aren't any doors, and I've become a big fan of the doors on the other airplanes Lego has released in the past few years that actually have realistic doors. Overall, this set is really great because it sells at a pretty fair price ($40), comes with a detailed plane, three minifigs that are good to have for any Lego airport, a radar tower which, when inserted in a Lego airport, adds cool detail, and an exclusive vehicle to "tow" the plane onto the runway from the terminal. A must-have for any Lego City (Airport) fans/collectors!

author: craigpowers
title: A Nice Regional Jet with Bonus Tug and Radar - Perfect for a Lego Airport
review:
I love everything about airplanes, and I have always loved the Lego airport sets.  But when it comes to set #3181, my love is not as centrally focused on the plane alone, as it is many of my other sets, but rather on the detailed, additional accessories in the form of a radar tower and an aircraft tug; both of which are of exceptional value to an airport nut, such as myself, and lend to a higher level of playability.

Pros

  • -Very strong set design overall.  The plane has good dimensions, balance and color scheme.  The radar is a simple, but nicely constructed piece and an essential to any airfield.  The tug is decent, but the tow bar is a fantastic accessory.
  • -Compatibility.  The radar is a universal accessory that can be placed among many other airport-themed sets and it compliments them all very well.  The tug and tow bar are especially handy for compiling a busy airport scenario.  The tug is capable of not only "hitching" to this jet, but it also fits the helicopter from set #3222, and, with some modification to the front landing gear arrangement, will also hitch to the helicopter from set #7738.
  • -Size.  Although there are many who argue that this airplane lacks the refinement of its larger brethren (aisle between seats, bathroom), I feel that the aircraft is a nice "medium sized" airplane.  Not all commercial liners are jumbos, and the regional airline business has soared as of late, giving rise to fleets of E-145s and CRJs, and this set serves as a model of these carriers.  Plus, it sits right between the large, commercial jets, and small, private aircraft, giving your airport some diversity.

Cons

  • -Price.  Very rarely do I complain about the cost of a Lego set, especially anything airport-related, which is my favorite theme.  But I felt that Lego may have reached a little on their asking price, given that there are only 3 minifigures to a set that should have at least 4.  The lone passenger looks so pathetic sitting in the airplane all by himself.
  • -Odd-colored bricks.  I get that Lego has, for the sake of simplifying building certain sets, added brightly colored pieces in order to distinguish them while going through the assembly steps.  Usually, they end up in places where they are completely obscured and not at all an impact on the overall aesthetic.  Yet, with this set, there are bright red pieces placed on the very edges of the wings on the bottom that are glaringly obvious.  Why Lego?  Why can't these be gray or some other subdued color?  As it is, it makes it look like these were put on as "replacement, wrong-color" parts to take place of what would have been gray pieces.  Fortunately, they are in a place where they can be easily exchanged, but why must I even have to do this?

I am overall very pleased with this purchase.  The airplane is the definite highlight of this set, but the accompanying tug and radar are such exceptional pieces based on their functionality that they more than make up for any shortcomings the aircraft, itself, may have.  If you have other aircraft already, this one will probably not top your list as a favorite, nor will it steal the spotlight from any collection, but it is almost an essential purchase, if just for the radar and the tug.

author: Lew11
title: Ready for takeoff!!
review:
Box/Instructions

I think that the box is quite nice, especially since it gives you pictures of the plane in action on the back

Parts

I think that the parts are good aswell, although, the cockpit and the back end pieces take away the main idea of lego, but I have to say: They are cool.

Minifigures

The minifiguires are quite reasonable aswell, it comes with a passenger, a pilot and a maintenence person. I could have came with more passengers though.

The build

The build isn't great but it is quite fun.

The completed model

I think the model is very cool, especially the satellite.

Summary

I think overall, that this plane is quite good, although it could be wider for more seats.

author: legoghostbusters
title: Great But...
review:
Starting off I'm a huge fan of the LEGO aviation world. I buy all the aviation related LEGO I can.

Box/Instructions

The box and instructions are the usual city ones nothing exciting here.

Parts

The part selection is GREAT! The small plane along side the larger plane (3182) looks so cool, I love how LEGO completely changed the build for "just another plane". Sadly no specially printed pieces :( just a whole lot of stickers.

Minifigures

The Passenger and the pilot aren't exciting, the pilots the usual and the passenger has nothing special about him. What I love about this set though is the ground worker, LEGO never really had to include him but yet they did. Which I love! Sadly this set doesn't come with a flight attendant.

The build

The build is very easy and straightforward. I've already broken it and didn't have to use instructions to put it back together. The actual interior is kind of sad. There is no door to exit/enter the jet and there is no ailse for the pilot or flight attendants. Also there is no "door" between the pilot and passengers.Even worse where is the toilet?

The completed model

Great exterior look. Sadly I can't fit woman with their hair onboard this jet. Which is a big letdown. Engines and wings give it that "private jet look" which actually I don't think LEGO should have gone, I would rather have wing-side engines. 

Overall opinion

Great "cheap" set for aviation fans. Lacks in good interior though. The roof parts need to be looked at again and improved. Wish it came with a aisle and toilet. Too many stickers for a set with this playability, needs to be all printed. Overall I rate this set a 4/5.
